author: Hadlee Simons
title: LG announces Marshmallow update
text:
Are you covered? Compare quotes for car, life and business insurance right now! 
Sign up for your free fax number and get faxes sent to your inbox! LG announces Marshmallow update Thu, 15 Oct 2015 2:00 PM Share Your Email The LG G4. 
LG has announced that it'll be one of the first to release the Android 6.0 (Marshmallow) update for its smartphones. 
The Polish version of the LG G4 will be the first phone to receive the update, beginning next week, the company confirmed in a press statement. 
LG said that other markets in Asia, Europe and the Americas would follow, without giving a timeframe. 
The new update introduces better permission support, a Doze mode for improving battery life and a Do Not Disturb mode of sorts. 
"By working closely with Google, LG has been able to bring Android 6.0 to the G4 ahead of any of our competitors," said Chris Yie, vice president and head of marketing communications for LG Mobile Communications Company. 
"While speed alone isn't an indicator of great service, it does go a long way toward giving consumers the confidence that LG is committed to its existing customers first." 
As for a South African release? An LG Mobile SA representative said that local users can expect Marshmallow to hit in "mid to end of November". Read More
